reviews.review: really unique and well designed game, i love the heck out of it and deserves the praise and hype from being a really strong and fun start to the Portal universe
Great game mechanics. Definitely a must have.

It's been a long time coming since I played this to write a review, but I have to put my thoughts on this down. Portal is an amazing puzzle solving game which was revolutionary at the time of its release by the portals and other technical pieces. Players could either take the game slow and learn as they go along while others can try to speed through it for the fastest time. This gave the players more of a drive to comeback and replay it. The game is a little too short though, but that was fixed in the newest game, Portal 2. Portal was an all around treat to play and Glados was probably my favorite part due to her humorous lines which kept me always waiting for the next sarcastic line to come out. This game I will recommend to anyone who wants an amazing puzzle experience.

10/10
~K4STOR

Its an oldie but a goodie.

it's most fun when your friend is with you and ze makes fun comments like "go get your cake! it's time for cake" while you are convinced cake will kill you!!! the ending was v good tho and v worth the months of short play sessions it took me :)
This game is an absolute masterpiece and I love it.

This game is the reason why I know Steam exists. Simple and straightforward, fun, slightly challenging. Very forgiving (it doesn't send you back an entire level if you mess up).
Portals.
Creepy robots.
Portals.
Science.
PORTALS.
[strike]Murdurous AI named GlaDOS[/strike] [b][u][i]CaKe!!! [/i][/u][/b]
PORTALS!
And LOTS of falling.

Too easy? Not enough falling? Give Portal 2 a shot. Extra [strike]cake[/strike] falling included.
Now, go get that cake waiting for you at the end!

A pretty good puzzle game, but I recommend playing the second one. It has better puzzles and better writing. Play this for "the cake is a lie" meme. Apart from that, the second game is better in every way.

If you are looking for a thought-provoking & innovative game, this is it. It'll start you off easy, and steadily progresses. The story line is awesome. Be aware there is also a Portal 2 that you should play AFTER portal 1.

Oh my word, what an enjoyable experience.  Some of the puzzles truly challenged the old gray matter, and the witty dialog had me laughing half the whole way.  The environments are well crafted, the interactions between portals are flawless, and the feel of the world is almost tangible.  I will have endless hours of replay and this game is never leaving my library.  

Opinions:
1) The storyline is nice but I would not call it "rich."  There is very little background to explain why humans were being tested in the first place or who the protagonist is as a character.  

2) The player has no choice on how to forward the storyline yet nearly everything is framed in the concept of a choice.  Alternate paths and solutions would actually create more options for the players than simply placing portals and following a hard scripted path to the finish line.   

3) She is superhuman?  Fall assist boots aside there are impacts and falls that no average human would survive.  On a few momentum challenges, she hits a railing that would cut her in half, and she can brush off bullet wounds in a few seconds.  I felt as if the protagonist was more of a robot than the coop versions in P2.

A lovely puzzle game based on a simple but ingenious mechanic of creating portals through which the player traverses. Though the sequel to this game does pretty much everything better, it is still worth playing through, if only for the laughs that the brilliant script provides. It only takes a couple of hours to complete and is a great warm up to Portal 2, which is one of the best games ever created in my opinion.
the game is fun and easy for every gamer and if you like fun puzzles i highly recomend this game its worth every penny and second. 1000/100

This game is really cool ive played both portal games so yeah. To anyone who hasn't played this game, you should try it.

So, it might've taken me long to complete this, even though my lethargic progress was painfully slow this is one of of the best games i've played - it uses thinking, quick thinking and a bit of persistance. I highly advise you buy this and, during the seasonal sales it costs less than a can of coke. Buy it, I beg of you.

Hands down one of my favorite games. The puzzles are engaging, flinging yourself across rooms is really fun, and the commentary/monologues that accompany you throughout are the kind of genius that sets a game apart from others.
Keeps surprising me each time I play it again.
One of the best games Valve has ever made, Give me Portal 3 already

A game every PC player should have the right to play. Easy to pick up, hard to master. The story line is amazingly simple but the lore makes it even better. The final boss and the last few areas take a bit of practice but ends on a great cliffhanger. 
Please not that I was not payed in cake to write this review.

Una historia simple, rompecabezas que no son nada del otro mundo y una experiencia en general algo corta para mi gusto. Pero pese a estos "fallos" lo recomiendo profundamente si te gustan los juegos y quieres probar esta obra de la cultura gaimer.

Simplemente imprescindible, un juegazo que no ha envejecido tan mal con una jugabilidad tan sencilla pero tan innovadora y divertida a la vez con una historia cargada de humor y carisma por parte de GLaDOS. Juego muy corto pero que a pesar de su poca duracion la aventura sera innolvidable, un juego que todo usuario de la PC Master Race deberia jugar.

Old now, but still a lovely puzzle-oriented game with an immersive atmosphere. Truly classic. A game that makes you think in 3 dimensions. No annoying timing-based problems; if you can understand the solution to a problem you can surely implement it -- great game for those of us lacking in fast-twitch muscles.
Its short and sweet. Pretty neat in design and how it plays. Easy story. Give it a try if on sale or free.
If you are new to pc gaming this one is a good option.
